nodes
Class Sensor

java.lang.Object
  nodes.Sensor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Sensor>, NoteConstants, Drawable, DataConstants, Transmitter, EndSteppable, Prepareable, Steppable, Saveable
public class Sensor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transmitter, Saveable, Prepareable, java.lang.Comparable<Sensor>, NoteConstants, DataConstants, EndSteppable, java.lang.Cloneable, Drawable

This is the Sensor class. It uses a protocol instance to handle its transmissions and a location instance to determine is locaiton.

Author:
Niels Thykier

Nested Class Summary
static class Sensor.SensorComparator
          A sorter for sensors that can sort sensors by various things.

Method Detail

assignLabel

public boolean assignLabel(java.lang.String label)
Assigns a label to the sensor.

Parameters:
label - The new label of the sensor. If null or "", the sensor's current label will be removed.
Returns:
true, if the label was updated.

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean running)
Change whether the sensor is operational.

Parameters:
running - true, if the sensor should work, false if it should not.

setHasTurn

public void setHasTurn(boolean isTurn)
Update whether the sensor currently has a turn.

Parameters:
isTurn - true, if the sensor has turn, false if it does not.

setSecondarySelection

protected void setSecondarySelection(boolean selectedStatus)
Internal method for updating "secondary selection". Secondary selection is when the sensor can be reached directly by a selected sensor.

Parameters:
selectedStatus - true, if a sensor that can reach this sensor is selected, otherwise false.

newTerminal

public void newTerminal(int through,
                        int terminalID,
                        int steps)
Notifies the sensor of a new terminal being available.

Parameters:
through - The sensor to send through to reach the terminal.
terminalID - The id of the terminal.
steps - The amount of steps to the new terminal (measured in sensors)

setSelected

public void setSelected(boolean selectedStatus)
Flag a sensor as selected or deselected. It will notify its links that they are now / no longer "secondarily selected"

Parameters:
selectedStatus - true if the sensor is selected, false if it is deselected.

setTerminalStatus

public Sensor setTerminalStatus(boolean terminal)
Turn a sensor into a terminal or a terminal into a sensor.

Parameters:
terminal - true if it should be upgrade to a terminal, false if downgraded to normal sensor.
Returns:
A new terminal or sensor depending on the input.

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Test if the Sensor is operational.

Returns:
true if the sensor is available.

Adds a link from this sensor to the other.

Parameters:
sen - The other sensor.

updateLinks

protected void updateLinks()
Forces the sensor to update the secondary selected. Used by the addLinkToSensor method but can also be called explicitly if the links have been modified without a call to that method.

getLinks

public java.lang.Integer[] getLinks()
Fetches a list of the sensors this sensor can reach. (Requires that the GlobalAddressBook has been updated)

Returns:
An array of Sensors that this sensor can reach.

Parameters:
sen - The other sensor
Returns:
true if they can communicate

public static int getSensorID(java.lang.String label)

setTransmissionRadius

public static void setTransmissionRadius(int newRadius)
Change the transmission radius. It must be greater (or equal to) than SENSOR_TRANSMISSION_RADIUS_MIN and less than (or equal to) SENSOR_TRANSMISSION_RADIUS_MAX

Parameters:
newRadius - The new radius they can communicate within.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the new radius was illegal.
